title: Corporate Workshops | Singapore Institute of Technology
text_lines: Community Leadership And Social Innovation Centre
Centre for Infrastructure and Tunnel Engineering
Rapid Product Innovation and Development Centre
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee
The Gift that Keeps on Giving
Community Leadership And Social Innovation Centre
Centre for Infrastructure and Tunnel Engineering
Rapid Product Innovation and Development Centre
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee
The Gift that Keeps on Giving
Lean and Kaizen for Continuous Improvement
Build practical skills using Lean and Kaizen methodologies, applying them to real, day-to-day tasks, for immediate relevance and lasting impact.
Be equipped with a broad spectrum of Lean skills
Benefit from our customised approach in studying the internal processes of your organisation and making specific recommendations for improvements
Enjoy on-site engagements conducted within your premises
Lean for Audit, Tax and Finance Professionals

Audit and Finance professionals have a responsibility to help their organisations improve processes and raise performance year on year. This course aims to equip participants with a mix of Lean, Audit and Accounting skills – all of which are necessary to bring the organisation to the next level.
Translate strategy into execution using Hoshin.
Identify and leverage on opportunities for process improvement.
Uncover genuine financial improvements that are hidden in traditional accounting.
Create a greater level of knowledge sharing and collaboration between auditor and organisational stakeholders.
Appreciate the application of FinTech to enhance auditing and accounting processes.
Understand and Improve your Operations through Continuous Flow (Lean)

Businesses fail to operate at full potential when their processes are hampered by frequent interruptions and resources are allocated unevenly. Learn how to apply Continuous Flow to mitigate these problems. Through simple games, we simulate real work situations to help participants grasp and comprehend these Lean concepts quickly.
Understand how Continuous Flow is superior to Batch Processing.
Learn to apply Continuous Flow in the participant's actual operations.
Learn the concepts of TOC and TAKT time.
Achieve higher outputs and reduce waste in the organisation.
Understand and Improve your Operations through A3 Structured Problem Solving (Lean)

Businesses are filled with complexities that may derail carefully conceived strategies. In this course, you will learn how to simplify these complexities into manageable segments. By applying Lean structured problem-solving methods, you will be shown step-by-step how complex issues are turned into sustainable solutions.
Understand how A3 structured problem solving is superior to conventional problem-solving.
Learn to apply A3 and RCA in the participant's actual operations.
Achieve higher outputs and reduce waste in the organisation.
Understand and Improve your Operations through Pull System & Error Proofing (Lean)

Fluctuating customer demand often leads to excess inventory and poor prioritisation of work. Learn how the Pull System can help you reduce inventory and still meet customer demand accurately and promptly. See how your working capital is unlocked for further business expansion.
Errors, defects and inconsistencies can disrupt your business and operations. Learn how to use Lean to minimise these problems and deliver better products and services to your customers.
Understand how Pull System and Error Proofing reduces inventory, obsolescence and defects.
Learn to apply Pull System and Error Proofing to the participant's operations.
Achieve higher outputs and reduce waste in the organisation.
Understand and Improve your Operations through Value Stream Mapping (Lean)
THE LEAN WAY TO ACHIEVE THE PERFECT PROCESS
Work is basically made up of processes. Optimisation of these processes will therefore lead to better work outcomes.
In this course, participants learn to map work processes clearly, spot problematic areas and identify opportunities for improvement.

We will demonstrate how Value Stream Mapping and Swim Lanes can significantly reduce lead times and speed up the delivery of products and services to your customers. A brief session on data analysis is also included in the programme. At the end of the course, participants will be equipped with Lean skills that can be applied across various industries.
Understand how Value Stream Mapping (VSM) surfaces deficiencies in a process.
Learn how Data Analysis supports VSM.
Learn to apply VSM and Data Analysis in the participant's actual operations.
Achieve higher outputs and reduce waste in the organisation.
Optimize your Capital Assets through Lean

Organisations spend a sizeable portion of their budgets on capital assets. It is therefore absolutely necessary that organisations extract maximum value from these assets, enough to cover their depreciation and more. In this course, you will learn Lean tools that will help you to optimise the utilisation of your assets. This course is also relevant for organisations without any capital assets as the Lean tools can be applied as well to daily operations and processes to achieve higher outputs.
Understand how 3 Lean tools (Total Productive Maintenance, Quick Changeover and Overall Equipment Effectiveness) can improve asset performance
Learn to apply the above tools in the participant's actual operations.
Achieve higher outputs and reduce waste in the organisation.

In today’s economy, companies face high expectations from customers and intense pressure from the competition. Companies are always looking for ways to be faster, better and cheaper. In this course, you will learn to take a deeper look at your operations and how to apply Lean methodology to achieve operations excellence.
Learn to use LEAN tools to evaluate operations.
Learn to use LEAN tools to improve operational efficiency.

Companies and organisations continue to exist only if they are financially viable. To stay viable, processes must be managed well to extract maximum output from minimum input. In this course, you will learn to examine different aspects of your business and how to apply Lean methodology to them to achieve business excellence.
Learn to use Lean tools to measure business performance.
Learn to use Lean tools to achieve business excellence.

Companies and organisations cannot remain stagnant in today’s business landscape. They need to innovate and find smarter ways to stay relevant. In this course, we will study the management practices that successful contemporary companies and organisations have weaved into their culture to help them succeed.
Module 1 focuses on the systems within the company.
Module 2 focuses on the people element.
Module 3 focuses on the market, products and services.
Understand how companies and organisations function.
Learn to apply contemporary management practices.
Learn to analyse and improve the systems within the company.

Companies and organisations cannot remain stagnant in today’s business landscape. They need to innovate and find smarter ways to stay relevant. In this course, we will study the management practices that successful contemporary companies and organisations have weaved into their culture to help them succeed.
Module 1 focuses on the systems within the company.
Module 2 focuses on the people element.
Module 3 focuses on the market, products and services.
Understand how companies and organisations function.
Learn to apply contemporary management practices.
Learn to review and improve the internal policies and structure affecting employees’ performance.

Companies and organisations cannot remain stagnant in today’s business landscape. They need to innovate and find smarter ways to stay relevant. In this course, we will study the management practices that successful contemporary companies and organisations have weaved into their culture to help them succeed.
Module 1 focuses on the systems within the company.
Module 2 focuses on the people element.
Module 3 focuses on the market, products and services.
Understand how companies and organisations function.
Learn to apply contemporary management practices.
Learn to scan the market and improve the way products and services are delivered.

This programme was originally designed to help SMRT equip their staff with the relevant skills stipulated in LTA’s Skills Framework for Public Transport. These skills are also relevant to most other industries.
Learn Hoshin strategic planning and deployment.
Learn to create and use VSM.

This programme was originally designed to help SMRT equip their staff with the relevant skills stipulated in LTA’s Skills Framework for Public Transport. These skills are also relevant to most other industries.
Learn to design and use Performance Indicators.
Learn to use simple financial tools to evaluate Lean projects.

This programme was originally designed to help SMRT equip their staff with the relevant skills stipulated in LTA’s Skills Framework for Public Transport. These skills are also relevant to most other industries.
Learn to design and use Performance Indicators.
Learn to use simple financial tools to evaluate Lean projects.

This programme was originally designed to help SMRT equip their staff with the relevant skills stipulated in LTA’s Skills Framework for Public Transport. These skills are also relevant to most other industries.
Learn Error Proofing in both design and process.
Learn Shop Floor Management for better control of operations.
Work with us to customize a corporate workshop exclusively
Singapore Institute of Technology. All Rights Reserved.

Corporate Workshops
Build practical skills using Lean and Kaizen methodologies, applying them to real, day-to-day tasks, for immediate relevance and lasting impact.
Key Takeaways
Be equipped with a broad spectrum of Lean skills
Benefit from our customised approach in studying the internal processes of your organisation and making specific recommendations for improvements
Enjoy on-site engagements conducted within your premises

Lean for Audit, Tax and Finance Professionals
Course Overview
Audit and Finance professionals have a responsibility to help their organisations improve processes and raise performance year on year. This course aims to equip participants with a mix of Lean, Audit and Accounting skills – all of which are necessary to bring the organisation to the next level.
What You'll Learn
Translate strategy into execution using Hoshin.
Identify and leverage on opportunities for process improvement.
Spot non-complying and resource-wasting activities.
Uncover genuine financial improvements that are hidden in traditional accounting.
Create a greater level of knowledge sharing and collaboration between auditor and organisational stakeholders.
Appreciate the application of FinTech to enhance auditing and accounting processes.

Contemporary Management Practices (Module 1)
Course Overview
Companies and organisations cannot remain stagnant in today’s business landscape. They need to innovate and find smarter ways to stay relevant. In this course, we will study the management practices that successful contemporary companies and organisations have weaved into their culture to help them succeed.
Module 1 focuses on the systems within the company.
Module 2 focuses on the people element.
Module 3 focuses on the market, products and services.
What You'll Learn
Understand how companies and organisations function.
Learn to apply contemporary management practices.
Learn to analyse and improve the systems within the company.

Advanced Lean Skills (Module 1)
Course Overview
This programme was originally designed to help SMRT equip their staff with the relevant skills stipulated in LTA’s Skills Framework for Public Transport. These skills are also relevant to most other industries.
What You'll Learn
Understand Lean fundamentals.
Learn Hoshin strategic planning and deployment.
Learn to create and use VSM.
Apply Lean to workplace projects.
chevron--up
Advanced Lean Skills (Module 2)
Course Overview
This programme was originally designed to help SMRT equip their staff with the relevant skills stipulated in LTA’s Skills Framework for Public Transport. These skills are also relevant to most other industries.
What You'll Learn
Learn basic Statistical Process Control.
Learn to design and use Performance Indicators.
Learn to use simple financial tools to evaluate Lean projects.
Apply Lean to workplace projects.
